p: The advent of pathogen attenuation through serial passage brought forth the most predominant category of LAVs, which are made directly through attenuation of the causative pathogen of a disease. Serial passage was performed in animal hosts, embryonated eggs, and eventually in tissue culture [ 31]. Some of the most notable, established LAVs generated this way are the yellow fever [ 32], poliovirus [ 33], measles [ 34], mumps [ 35], rubella [ 36], typhoid [ 37], varicella [ 38], and zoster [ 39] vaccines.
